CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 6-2;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is currently serving a sentence in correctional facility ZhKh–CARDINAL/CARDINAL in the village of ORG , GPE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant on charges of abuse of powers by a public official , aggravated bribery and forgery .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and placed in custody on suspicion of aggravated murder and robbery .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was officially charged with aggravated murder and robbery .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was convicted of abuse of powers , aggravated bribery and forgery and sentenced to DATE imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE , whilst the pre - trial investigation into the murder and robbery was pending , the ORG local television company , ORG , broadcast the Na grani ( “ On the Edge ” ) programme which contained an interview with PERSON , an investigator from the prosecutor 's office of LOC ( “ the prosecutor 's office ” ) , who informed the public that the applicant had committed a series of offences . In particular , he stated that :

“ The murder was committed while the investigation into bribery and abuse of power [ with which the applicant had been charged ] had been pending for a sufficiently long time and it was possible to refer the case to a court . And we found out that PERSON had committed a second , more serious , crime – a murder , connected to the robbery and attack . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a civil claim against the prosecutor 's office and ORG . Referring to LAW , he sought compensation for non - pecuniary damage resulting from the alleged violation of the presumption of innocence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG the district court ” ) held a hearing in the applicant 's presence and decided that it could not examine the claim while the criminal proceedings against the applicant were pending , because it was essential to know the outcome of those proceedings in order to determine whether the disseminated information was true or false . Therefore , the district court ordered the proceedings to be suspended .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of murder and robbery and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . On CARDINAL DATE the judgment became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district court informed the applicant that the proceedings in respect of his defamation claim had been resumed and a hearing had been scheduled for DATE . The court asked the applicant if he wished to continue with his claim , and requested him to submit written explanations .

CARDINAL . In his reply of DATE the applicant modified his statement of claims , withdrew the claim against ORG and affirmed his wish to continue with his claim against the prosecutor 's office . He also asked the court to examine the case in his presence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district court held the hearing in the applicant 's absence . It does not appear from the case materials that it examined the applicant 's request to appear in the courtroom . Having studied the applicant 's written submissions and having heard the representative of the prosecutor 's office , it rejected the claim . According to the Government , the representative of the prosecutor 's office advanced no new arguments against the claim during the hearing . The district court found that the impugned statement had been based on facts which had subsequently been established in the court judgment of DATE . With regard to arguments by the applicant that the investigator was not entitled to publicly state that the applicant was guilty until this had been proved according to law , the court said that , by the date of the broadcast , the applicant had already been charged with murder and robbery , which , under LAW , was possible only if sufficient evidence existed . The issue of the applicant 's absence was addressed in the district court 's decision as follows :
“ The plaintiff was not present at the hearing because he had been sentenced ... to DATE imprisonment ... The court received [ the plaintiff 's ] written comments about the claim made ... ”

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against this judgment . He claimed , inter alia , that the principle of equality of arms had been breached , as the court had refused to summon him and hear him in person .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , then detained in the correctional facility in GPE , was notified of the time and place of an appeal hearing in his defamation case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held an appeal hearing in the absence of the parties and upheld the judgment of DATE with minor changes . The appeal judgment , in so far as relevant , read as follows :

“ ... [ the district ] court ensured PERSON 's participation in the hearing of DATE although the laws on civil procedure in force do not require the court to ensure the presence in a courtroom of persons kept in custody or sentenced to imprisonment .

[ The district ] court duly notified PERSON of the date of the hearing . The plaintiff sent to the [ district ] court his written comments on the nature of his claims . The reasons given in those comments were studied and duly assessed by the [ district ] court . ”

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW of the Russian Federation provides that everyone accused of committing a crime shall be considered innocent until his guilt is proved according to the rules fixed by the federal law and confirmed by the sentence of a court which has come into legal force .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the NORP Civil Code provides that compensation for non - pecuniary damage is payable only when physical or moral damage has been inflicted on a person through actions which violate his or her rights .

CARDINAL . By virtue of ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , a court may hold a session outside the courthouse if , for instance , it is necessary to examine evidence which can not be brought to the courthouse .

CARDINAL . On several occasions ORG of GPE has examined complaints by convicted persons whose requests for leave to appear in civil proceedings had been refused by courts . It has consistently declared the complaints inadmissible , finding that the contested provisions of LAW and LAW did not , as such , restrict the convicted person 's access to court . It has emphasised , nonetheless , that the convicted person should be able to make submissions to the civil court , either through a representative or in any other way provided by law . If necessary , the hearing may be held at the location where the convicted person is serving his or her sentence or , alternatively , the court hearing the case may instruct the court having territorial jurisdiction over the correctional colony to obtain the applicant 's submissions or carry out any other procedural steps ( decisions no . CARDINAL-O of DATE , no . CARDINAL of DATE , and no . CARDINAL of DATE ) .
